intro: Decaryella madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, green berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
